result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian J. Gerow was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Disorderly conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.
The defendant may not consume or possess alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns.

The defendant must participate and successfully complete an anger management assessment and follow thru with any recommendations.

The defendant must submit a DNA sample.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian J. Gerow

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Brian J. Gerow in court with attorney Michael Scholke.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 11:12 AM. State - resolved - amend #1 to county ordinance of DC with $500.00 forfeiture plus costs, plead to #2 as alleged wth 12 months probation, #3 - DRI, have complied with victim notification requirements with no response, no possession of alcohol and no entry, AODA, employment/school, 50 hours of community service. Gerow and Scholke agree. Court amends count #1 to county ordinance of DC, pleads G, finds G, fine of $500.00 plus costs totalling $834.00 - 60 DTP/CO, court dismisses and reads in count #3. Gerow pleads NC to count #2 as alleged. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Scholke makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation - asks that probation not hinder him from working in Michigan. Gerow makes statement. Court sentences the defendant to the following: count #2 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 1 year with conditions of: AODA and follow thru, participate and complete an anger management assessment and follow thru with any recommendations, no consumption or possession of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, costs - including $10.00 drug abuse surcharge - paid thru probation, 50 hours community service, maintain/obtain full time employment/school, submit DNA sample with expungement rights given, right to appeal, adjourned.
Final pre-trial on September 28, 2016 at 10:45 am.

Defendant Brian J. Gerow in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:41 AM. Gerow has complaint. Court reads charges and penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Gerow understands charges and penalties, wants an attorney, recess to talk to SPD. Recalled at 11:32 AM now appears with Michael Scholke as he qualifes for SPD. Scholke has complaint, has gone over it with the defendant, waives further reading, enters NG plea, set for FPT. State - bond - $1000 signature bond, no consumption of alcohol. Scholke has no objections. Court - bond - $1000.00 signature bond with no consumption of alcohol, refund bond to poster.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 28, 2016 at 10:45 am.
Bonded out prior to probable cause.
